page.title: 01Limestone Ridge N of Lincoln
page.content: This is an agricultural area, mainly arable with a small amount of pasture and woodland near the centre. It includes the small picturesque village of Hackthorn which stands to the east of the A15 (Ermine Street). Barley, wheat, rape, potatoes and sugar beet are the main crops. A fwe sheep and cattle are farmed. Fields are divided by hedges and ditches many of which have been removed to accommodate the increasing size of modern machinery. Only a few inhabitants work on the land; many are connected with the professions and commute outside the area; a number are retired. Most farm houses and cottages have been modernised. At the west end of the village is The Hall, Church and Village Hall surrounded by parkland. The park, used for grazing but designed to be
